III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two staff members have been sexually assaulting a youth at the
facility. They also tell the youth sexually inappropriate things.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed at the facility on 11/26/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Administrator 1 reported
Youth A disclosed to Manager on 11/21/2024 that there were two
separate incidents several months ago that involved Staff 1 and
Staff 2. He said there are no previous incidents or grievances
reported by Youth A. On 11/22/2024 Staff 1 and Staff 2 were put
on administrative leave pending the investigation.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 11/26/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the
facility for six months. Youth A was very withdrawn and hesitated
about answering questions. Youth A reported he is attending
weekly therapy sessions. Youth A expressed no concerns
regarding the youths on his unit. He reported there was one
incident two months ago on the unit involving Staff 1 touching him
when he was on the unit. He would not provide the date, time,
where he was touched, or if anyone witnessed the incident. He
said there was another incident several weeks ago in the
lunchroom involving Staff 2 talking about grooming. Again, he
would not provide specific details about what was said or if other
youths were present. He recalled maybe Staff 3 was present for
the incident in the cafeteria. Youth A requested to end the interview
and refused to answer any other questions.
Administrator 2 was interviewed at the facility on 11/26/2024 and
on 12/19/24 in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Administrator
2 reported Youth A didn’t provide specific dates, so it was difficult
to find video footage. She said Manager 1 did review random video
footage for October and November of 2024 when Staff 1 and Staff
2 were scheduled to be working, and no footage was found of
2

either incident. Youth A never reported any previous concerns
regarding any staff member. She said Staff 1 works on the unit and
Staff 2 works primarily in the kitchen serving food. Staff 1 and Staff
2 have no disciplinary records and there are no incident reports
regarding either staff member.
Manager 1 was interviewed at the facility on 11/26/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Manager 1 is the case
manager assigned to Youth A. She reported on 11/21/2024 she
was having a one-on-one meeting with Youth A, and that’s when
Youth A told her he wanted to tell her something, but wanted to
make sure she does not judge him. Youth A told her there were
two staff members that touched his private area, which led to him
to touching them, but would not provide specific details or names of
the staff members. Manager 1 attempted again to speak to Youth A
on 11/22/2024 and that’s when Youth A reported the 1st incident
occurred on the unit, two months ago, involved Staff 1, but didn’t
provide any details. He said Staff 1 whispered in his ears what she
wants to do with him. The 2nd incident happened in the lunchroom,
involved Staff 2, talking to him about grooming, touching him over
his clothes, and he in return touched her over her clothes. He
further reported Staff 1 drank from his water bottle and licked the
rim of the bottle in a seductive manner.
Manager 2 was interviewed at the facility on 11/26/2024 and on
12/17/2024, in collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Manager 2
reported she spoke with Staff 3 on 11/22/24, and Staff 3 recalled
witnessing Staff 2 in the lunchroom drink and lick the rim of the
youth’s water bottle. Staff 3 does not recall the date when this
occurred. Manager 2 reported she has been reviewing video
footage for the past two months but has yet to find any footage of
the incident. She said there has been no reported concerns for
Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 11/26/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Therapist has been working
with Youth A for almost six months. She has built a good rapport
with Youth A and was very surprised by the allegations. She said
Youth A has never reported any concerns regarding staff members
touching or doing anything inappropriate.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 11/26/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor is the kitchen staff
supervisor. He reported Staff 2 has been working in the kitchen for
two months. Supervisor said youths are not allowed in the kitchen
3

area and he has never observed Staff 2 alone with any youths. He
denied witnessing Staff 2 acting inappropriate with Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 12/13/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 has been working at
the facility for one year. Staff 3 recalls witnessing Staff 2 drink from
Youth B’s water bottle and licking the rim of the bottle. He does not
recall the date, but said it happened in the lunchroom and recalls
Youth A and Youth B were sitting at the table in the lunchroom,
Staff 2 walked over to their table, grabbed Youth B’s water bottle
took a sip of water, and licked the rim of the bottle. Staff 3 did find
the incident strange but denied witnessing any physical touching by
Staff 2 or Youth A. Staff 3 denied witnessing any other incident
involving Staff 2. He further denied witnessing any inappropriate
touching involving Youth A and Staff 1.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 12/13/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the
facility for six months and is placed on the same unit with Youth A.
Youth B recalls an incident in the lunchroom when Staff 2 drank
from his water bottle, but denied she licked the bottle. He was
shocked that she drank from the water bottle and threw it away
afterwards. Youth B recalls having a conversation with Staff 2
about what actions are considered to be grooming but denied any
inappropriate touching by Staff 2. Youth B reported Youth C had
made comments like, “you are grooming” and that’s how the
conversation with Staff 2 occurred. He denied any inappropriate
touching or comments by Staff 2 or any other staff. Youth B
reported feeling safe and denied any concerns regarding the facility
or the staff.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 12/13/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the
facility for 11 months. Youth C admitted that he sometimes will
make comments about grooming but denied any inappropriate
touching or hugging with any of the staff at the facility. He denied
hearing Staff 2 having a conversation about grooming or drinking
from Youth B’s water bottle. Youth C reported feeling safe and
expressed no concerns regarding staff members.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 12/19/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been working at
the facility for almost one year. Staff 1 denied having any
inappropriate conversations, or whispering anything inappropriate
to Youth A. She recalls only giving Youth A a side hug, which at the
time was allowed, but now staff have been informed to not give
4

side hugs. She denied ever being alone on the unit with Youth A.
Staff 1 reports she has a good rapport with all the youths including
Youth A.
Attempts were made to interview Staff 2 at her home and via
telephone on 12/17/2024, and at the facility on 12/19/2024. All
attempts were unsuccessful. Staff 2 did not return to work and has
resigned from the facility effective 12/30/2024.
Documents Reviewed:
• Facility’s policy for Standard of Conduct. Employee shall
conduct themself in a manner to further Rite of Passage’s
mission of providing high quality, professional, courteous
and efficient services to the students in their care
Employees are expected to discharge the duties and
responsibilities of their positions in a manner that upholds an
environment of trust and professionalism that reflects the
highest ethical standards.
• Facility’s policy Maintaining Healthy Boundaries states staff
shall interact and communicate with youths in a professional
manner to include boundaries that support the youth with
dignity and respect. Some examples of contact with youth
that are considered healthy forms of physical contact are
shaking hands, lightly and briefly tapping on the arms or
shoulder to get their attention, and a high five or fist bump.
Any type of touching such as hugs or other affectionate
gestures are prohibited.
• Facility Manager completed an internal investigation and this
report concluded there was no evidence Staff 1 and Staff 2
engaged in by PREA definitions of sexual abuse/sexual
harassment against Youth A. The report stated Staff 2 was
interviewed on 12/04/2024 and Staff 2 denied any
inappropriate touching with Youth A. Staff 2 recalled a
conversation with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. She could
not recall the date, but said it was in the dining area, and
she was sitting with Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C at the
lunch table. She said the youths were talking about what is
considered grooming. Youth B said giving someone a nick
name would be considered grooming, Youth A said grabbing
someone’s knee would be grooming and that’s when Youth
A grabbed her knee. She immediately removed his hand off
her knee. She said it was less than a couple of seconds.
She denied any inappropriate touching happened and
further denied ever touching Youth A inappropriately.
• Staff 1 and Staff 2 personnel files: They have no disciplinary
records.
5

Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted and
documentation reviewed, there is insufficient evidence that staff
sexually assaulted a youth.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was provided regarding updating the facility’s
policy for maintaining healthy boundaries to be specific regarding
prohibiting staff giving youths side hugs.
Consultation:
Consultation was provided regarding staff not consuming from a
youth’s water bottle along with reporting any incidents that appear
unusual.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
